snippet: While the protest began over plans to destroy a park, for many demonstrators it had moved beyond that to become a broad rebuke to the 10-year leadership of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
abstract: Police withdraw from Istanbul’s central Taksim Square, allowing demonstrators to gather unimpeded in contested park; focus of protest has evolved to become broad rebuke to 10-year leadership of Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who has vowed to proceed with plan to raze park.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: While the protest began over plans to destroy a park, for many demonstrators it had moved beyond that to become a broad rebuke to the 10-year leadership of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

headline.seo: Police Retreat in Istanbul as Protests Expand Through Turkey
headline.main: Police Retreat as Protests Expand Through Turkey
headline.print_headline: Police Retreat in Istanbul as Protests Expand Through Turkey
